Articles.Content: Anyone know why stock kerbin sky goes blindingly white, the light blue and then an even darker blue

Its just a placeholder, unfinished sky as far as I know.. download EVE and a one of the visual packs to make it look right. Also.. I gotta ask. I know some people like to play stock, but why not atleast with visual enhancements? If your computer has the power of a potato then, yea sure.. But again to answer your question.. its just Squads crappy stock atmosphere.

One nice thing about EVE is that the Github archive for the versions of it goes way back. If you are running a slower rig, try finding one of the versions right before the release of volumetric clouds. Won't look as nice as the more advanced versions, but it still looks better than stock.

Also.. I gotta ask. I know some people like to play stock, but why not atleast with visual enhancements? If your computer has the power of a potato then, yea sure..

A forklift is a relatively simple vehicle. However, having never driven one, I wouldn't trust myself at the controls.

I can't speak for the OP, but I held off on a modded KSP until VERY recently because I didn't trust myself enough to NOT break the core game.

So there's one reason.

I play without eve because a really useless computer but I might try your suggestion boomerang.

Also would it not of been easier for them to just put an all light blue sky till you got upto 10km then have the sky fade to dark blue until 30km up then it fades to black.

or better yet make so the sky is all blue.

also im not against mods, if I was I don't know why I would have B9, but then again I only use it for making C-17's
